info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 3:21PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Yuma County in northeastern Colorado and west central Cheyenne Counties in northwestern Kansas through 345 PM MDT/445 PM CDT/... At 321 PM MDT/421 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles northeast of Bonny Reservoir. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of eastern Yuma County in northeastern Colorado and west central Cheyenne Counties in northwestern Kansas. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
